newsitem.title: JAPAN: Fuji TV, Sony agree to invest in JSkyB - paper.
newsitem.headline: Fuji TV, Sony agree to invest in JSkyB - paper.

text.p: Fuji Television Network and Sony Corp have agreed to become equal partners in a Japanese satellite broadcasting venture, Japan Sky Broadcasting Corp (JSkyB), together with News Corp and Softbank Corp, a Japanese business daily said on Tuesday.
JSkyB was set up by News Corp and computer software publishing and exhibition company Softbank Corp.
The Nihon Keizai Shimbun said Fuji Television Network, a Japanese terrestrial broadcasting firm, and the three other partners would each have equal stakes in JSkyB as major shareholders.
Four other investors will be minor shareholders in JSkyB, the paper said without mentioning specific names.
Last week, a JSkyB spokesman said that it was talking with Walt Disney Co on a possible capital participation.
On Tuesday, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported that Disney had not agreed to invest in JSkyB, not making clear whether talks were continuing or not.
Another JSkyB spokesman said on Tuesday that the company and Fuji were positively considering Fuji's participation in the venture but added that they have not yet reached a conclusion.
A Sony spokesman said that the company was positive about possibly investing in JSkyB.
Fuji spokesmen were not immediately available for comment.
